headline: Beer Margaritas
description: This beerita recipe uses beer, tequila, water, and frozen limeade concentrate to make a quick and dirty margarita for your boozy loving friends.

video.description: Beer joins tequila in this refreshing adult beverage.
video.name: Beer Margaritas

name: Beer Margaritas
recipeIngredient: 1 (12 fluid ounce) can frozen limeade concentrate
12 fluid ounces water, or more as needed

recipeInstructions.text: Pour limeade concentrate, tequila, water, and beer into a large pitcher. Stir until limeade has melted.
Add plenty of ice to the pitcher and garnish with lime wedges. Adjust with additional water if needed.

review.reviewBody: Made exactly as the recipe was written. Hard to tell beer was an ingredient by taste. Very easy…we liked it. Thank you for the recipe. :)
Fantastic. Followed the directions without modifications. I'll make these again.
So good. You will not be able to walk after these.

Did exactly as directed (yes, to Mexican beer), and will continue to do so. It's our "go to" margarita and we call it the Quad 12 (4 items and 12 oz each). It CAN get you in trouble because it goes down so smooth. If you want it a tad sweeter, use 1oz. of triple sec.
I have made these several times now and they are delicious! I like the flexibility of using less alcohol if you desire. If you have leftovers, freeze for a frozen margarita! Delicious!
I've been making this for about 20 yrs. My son's best friend was a bartender and shared this one. It's best for reunions, right "Niners"?

I had to laugh when I saw this recipe! One of my husband’s fraternity brothers taught us how to make his mother’s beer whiskey sours. Same idea, just use lemonade and whiskey. A change of pace, or some like me who can’t drink tequila, a great summer party drink!
I have been making these for years and they are always a hit at every function!
Yeah, these are shockingly good (and easy). Be careful though, easy to over imbibe.

Corona Light, for sure. Tried the LightSky (the Blue Moon light beer), not great. Did the Corona Light, it was great! I would stick with the recipe, but, I would only use 3/4 of the limeade. Gonna try it again with frozen lemonade concentrate, as I like lemon better! Great recipe! Thanks!
I do believe it's 5:00!!
absolutely delicious! wouldn't change a darn thing!! thank you for sharing your recipe and adding to my cocktail resume

I like the idea of using beer in Margaritas as I have enjoyed this drink in a really popular Mexican restaurant in my town.I had to substitute the frozen limeade to a sugarfree lemon drink mix, as I forgot to buy that ingredient for a last minute 4th of July drink.., honestly I believe it was hard to tell the difference,maybe less strong? I added fresh lime juice to add more lime flavor 
and replaced the water with sugar free Smirnoff Ice Zero sugar and I used Michelob light. So refreshing and enjoyable on a hot day!
I used white tequila and also used 7-Up in place of the water and these were a huge hit at our Super Bowl party! will definitely make them again.
2020 Super Bowl drink. This was a big hit!! All the guest loved the Beer margaritas. I did add an extra bottle of beer instead of extra H20. Go Chiefs!!! I will definitely make this drink again.

I love this recipe and make it whenever I have a crowd to serve. The only thing I change is to omit the water and use Squirt soda for a less sweet grapefruit flavor. I also always use a splash of Grand Marnier at the end. So good!!
Excellent. Exactly what I have been looking for. I agree with one review; exchange the water portion for Sprite/7-Up
It's good
I will make it again
So much better than store bought margarita mixes
Yep, this made our frozen margaritas even better. Love it.

Nice recipe. I like my drinks strong, so I cut out the water and just added a lot of ice. I also added a little pineapple juice to take some of the sharp edge off. This is a good, easy to make, crowd-pleaser...at least in our household.
It's better when you leave out the can of water. This has been our margarita recipe for 30 plus years - my husband picked it up when he was in the Navy. We use Heinekin Beer.
Much better with water than with 7 Up or Sprite.
I’ve been make these since the 1970’s: 12 oz of Horiito’s Tequila

These are wonderful. I’ve been making them for a few years now and everyone always loves them. We love margaritas and have tried so many recipes but this one is by far the best frozen margarita recipe out there!!
I did not add the water. Just pour over crushed ice and let the ice melt a little. Found this recipe over30 yrs ago. Usually do not but maybe 10 oz of tequila
I make this all year long, depending on the brand some lime aid's tend to be sweet (Seneca brand) so a squeeze of fresh lime helps. Everyone loves these!
Makes a really good margarita.
I use Squirt Soda instead of the water or Sprite . It is much less sweet. If you really want to bump it up, add a splash of Grand Marnier.
Made it for my New Year's Eve party and it was a hit !!!!!
Awesome!
No changes. I will make it again.
I’ve made this many ‘‘tis many times exactly as is and it rivals any Bar Marguerita

Family favorite for years. Its fame has spread so that it's nearly impossible to find Minute Maid Lime Frozen Concentrate (the best) around certain holidays. When we find them, we clean out the store and put them in the garage freezer. We've tried others, but they don't taste as good as M). Yes, we are hoarding! So if the "big one" hits, we will be well lubricated. Delish!
MMy
LOVE IT
Not quite as good as a regular margarita but really close. Still prefer the more fruity flavor of a real margarita. Would make again, especially if out of triple sec.
Awesome margaritas!!!!
I used a Sam Adams Boston lager. I did not have frozen line are, so I used frozen lemonade. I also added 12 ounces of orange juice.

A very tasty and refreshing summer drink. I made it exactly as the recipe stated except I did not add ice to the entire batch. I just filled each individual glass with lots of ice and topped with a squeeze of lime.Update: a splash of orange liqueur takes it up a notch!
I’ve been making a version of this for years. We use 1 small can frozen limeade, 1 small can frozen berry punch, 1& 1/2 cans tequila, 1 bottle beer (12oz) and 1 small can water.

3.9.18 Who knew that beer could be so good in a margarita?? I used Jose Cuervo Gold and a lager, so the color was a little darker than most margaritas, but you positively could not taste the beer in this drink. Very nice.
excellent. definitely a mix between Margarita and beer. easy enough to make. if you like the taste of either one more than the other, just add more of the other.
I've been making this for years. It's a huge hit and requested for every party.

This recipe is the best margarita "hack." I make this for parties and people go crazy for it. Sometimes I throw in a handful of cherries, strawberries or chopped mango and friends think I'm a pro! Cheers!
Made the original recipe and we loved it. Squeezing a fresh lime wedge in each drink made it delicious. May try adding some cointreau next time...

I have made these for years!!!! I use a clear soda instead of water, 7 up, gingerale, whatever - it works. You can adjust it to your liking - add triple sec or whatever. Best tip ever: Freeze left overs in jelly or mason jars - screw the lid on! As a matter of fact - we make them in advance and keep them in the freezer. So much fun to pull one out on a hot day or for a guest!
This was by far, the BEST margarita recipe I've ever had! I love margaritas but can't stand that fake bottled sweet and sour mix! This didn't have that at all! Great recipe and thanks for sharing!

I never leave reviews. Never. But I made this for July 4 weekend, and I just had to. First off, I am a margarita purist. I really, really love a good one, and bad ones just tick me off. So when I read this recipe, with BEER in it, I expected to hate it. But a friend told me the really excellent Mexican place near her house puts beer in their margarita, so I had to try it. I followed the recipe exactly, except I used 9oz tequila instead of 12. I ended up adding an extra splash, though, so probably closer to 10 oz. HOLY COW!!! 1000x better than expected! I immediately texted the recipe to everyone I know! This is my new fave. None of the heartburney effect of a normal Rita, and it tastes better than anything I have ever made at home. Hubby and I went through 2 pitchers (since the kids are at Grandpa's)!! Good times were had by all!

I have been making a version of this margarita recipe for years. It is the best at home mix going. My recipe is a bit different. I will share mine with you. 
1 12 oz can of frozen limeade (save can)
1 12 oz can of tequila (hence saved can)
1 bottle of Cirrona beer, I prefer bud light lime
1 can of sprite ( replaces water)
Stir mixture until the limeade has melted
I pour the mixture i to a large pitcher full of ice.
I have made this in a thermal cooler that has a pour spout and taken it to the lake. It will last all day in hot weather. 
I have also made the same mixture, with crush ice, in a frozen margarita machine. Either way you will never find a better margarita recipe. Cheers!!
I added more beer and water ... loved it!
So delicious and refreshing!! I could made this all summer long...

I've used this recipe for nearly 45 years. Got it from a bartender at the (former) Village Inn in Coronado Island, CA. Back then we couldn't afford expensive prebottled mixers, or anything like expensive tequila. The beer smoothed out the taste of the raw tequila we bought in Mexico, and the girls and guys loved it - still do! Just adjust the amount of water to your individual tastes. One can of water is a good starting point!
So easy to make and it was great. Everyone loved it and had to make a 2nd batch. Will definitely make again for family and friends.
I made exactly as directions said except no ice in the pitcher. its great the way it is but I will try some of the suggestions next time.

I have made these for many years. I always add two beers and two diet sprites or 7-up and no water. I use select 56 and diet pop to cut down on sugar and calories-you won't be able to tell the difference !!

The real recipe calls for equal parts limeade and tequila, a bottle of Corona and 12pz of 7UP and NO WATER! With these changes it is a 5* recipe and we have a pitcher at most gatherings. I was told it was the "Red Hat" recipe.
fantastic
So fun. So easy. Buy lots of limeade. They go quicker than you think. Also best if you have a heavy duty blender.
The Best Margarita by far!!! even if you are not a beer drinker, trust me you will love this.
I thought this was terrible, no one at my party likes it we had to really doctor it up to be good
Yumm!! Added a little oj and some h20 for on the rocks.

When I lived in NM we used the same recipe but substituted Vodka for the Tequila and called them Bullfrogs. All I can say is YUM and WHOOPIE! ??

Both methods are flawless!
I used Sprite instead of water. Everyone loved these, and I will definitely make them again.
Big hit with friends and spouse!
Excellent and great summer adult treat!

These are awesome! We've been making these for years but have always called them Tailgate Margaritas as they are so easy to make in the parking lot!! All you need is the pitcher & what you have in the cooler!
This is a keeper! I doubled the beer (Corona) to cut down on the sweetness, used Quervo Silver, and exchanged a small amount of tequila for a little triple sec. Everyone who's tried it loves it!

I am sipping this now, and it's happy hour perfect! I really wanted to try this recipe but only had the frozen orange juice concentrate on hand so I took a chance and made a half batch, squeezing in a bit of fresh lime juice. It might be a tad sweet because of the orange, but I will try it with the limeade next time. Thoroughly enjoying this one!

Very simple take on beer margaritas (also termed coronitas) by using simple limeade as the flavor source. It is VERY strong with tequila. However, the amount of beer was actually very little (25%), whereas many of these recipes use more. I recommend adding replacing 6oz of the water with 6oz of more Corona. If you like it weaker, cut the tequila down to 9oz instead of 12oz. Will make again!

Made this with Corona and 1800 tequila. There were only two of us drinking this so we halved everything but the beer, and still the beer did not taste too powerful. Good-quality tequila is really essential since there are so few ingredients. We later had just a mix of beer and the limeade and found that it was much more well-balanced with the water and tequila added in. 

Definitely a simple but delicious drink to sip on during the summer months.
Very good! Use water not soda like others mentioned as it'll be too sweet otherwise. Makes about 5 larger servings.
I made this just as written, no changes at all. We and all who have tried this love it. Super easy, super good margaritas. Now it has become a summer time/any time favorite beverage.
Followed as directed - just used water, not pop as some viewers did - it was fabulous! Will make again.
Will definitely make again. Have shared recipe with three other people so far. Surprisingly refreshing drink.
Made it as is. It tasted good a bit on the sweet side.

Followed directions exactly. Used Corona Light beer. Excellent light tasting drink. Will be a perfect summer drink
 Williams definitely make again!
I have made this many times and it is very easy and good
I have been making this for years! I use Sprite instead of water. Careful! It will bite ya! ;-)

For me who hates beer but is always down to try new thing, this was still too much beer taste for me. My parents who like beer didn't think it tasted like beer at all. We used Coors Banquet. I guess that's not very helpful but if you really hate beer, you probably won't like them but it wasn't terrible by any means so give it a go!
Been making these a while, only difference I add a diet Sprite, or 7-up, delish!

LOVE this very simple drink, but simplified even more! 
I do not add any water, but add 16 oz (2 cups) of crushed ice in place of the water . I then place everything in the blender EXCEPT for the beer ~ BLEND! 
Pour into a glass and leave room to top the drink off with the beer, gently mix and place a slice of lime in the drink.
Excellent!

I figured I've made this recipe SO many times that it's about time I reviewed it. I make this recipe as written, no changes. It is a smooth drink that packs a punch. Quick and easy to whip together, and minimal clean-up.

Really tasty stuff! The only change I made was to cut the water to 10 ounces and add 2 ounces of triple sec. I put all ingredients, except the beer (I used Corona) in the blender to eliminate any pulp from the limeaid, then added the beer after blending. At first, it was a bit sour, but after sitting in the fridge until party time, it was fantastic!

I followed the recipe exactly. Why make changes in a perfect
recipe?? It was delightful and we loved it
I made it exactly as stated but with a Mexican beer. It's soooo good. I will be making this again

I have been making a slightly different version of his for years and love it! Same lime aid and tequila but no water and add 3 12 oz. bottles of corona. Always mix the lime aid and tequila first and then gently stir in the beer so you don't make it flat. Fill a glass with ice and garnish with a lime. Yummy!!!

I doubled this recipe and took it to a neighbors house for dinner. It got RAVE reviews. Everyone loved it and some said it was the best margarita they've ever had. Plus was that they are quite potent! A++

I followed the recipe exactly, I think that substituting the water with soda would make it way too sweet.

I know this doesn't sound good, but I was taught to use milk instead of water. just try it once. I put it in the freezer and when I am ready for a drink I mix 1 cup of the mix with a cup of crushed ice and blend very well. oh my, so refreshing.
I've been making that recipe for years and it's a great twist on a margarita
Very good, but it's better if you sub Mountain Dew in place of water. gives it a nice tangy flavor

I have a similar recipe called "Mambo Margarita" Instead of water I use lemon-lime soda. You can do it in a pitcher as directed or put the limeade, ice and tequila in the blender. add the soda and beer after. Either way, these are the best margaritas!
Family friends made them years ago. We call them white trash margaritas and they're amazing!

I made a few changes due to the suggestions. I used white tequila, limeade, triple sec, juice of one lime, some lemon-lime soda and a Corona beer and crushed ice. Wow! That was soo good! And potent! My friend wasn't sure about the 'beer' part until she tasted it! Then she loved it and said I could come over and make cocktails anytime I want to!
Great summer drink!
This was fantastic!!! I made them exactly as published and is now a keeper. Thanks!
This is a nice combination....

This is super easy and good for a crowd. I like that you can use the limeade can to measure the tequila and water, too. I made mine in the blender, with extra ice, and added a Corona beer after blending to avoid fizz-over. I also tried a version with frozen strawberries in place of some of the ice. Very fruity, and not beer-y at all!
